p: Cyclooxygenase (COX) is a key enzyme responsible for brain inflammation in AD patients. It is shown that non-steroidal anti-inflammatory (NSAIDs) drugs play their anti-inflammatory role by inhibition of COX ll. Also, in AD patients, the amount of C-reactive protein and IL-6, as inflammation biomarkers, is considerably higher than in normal people, particularly in the early stages of the disease ( 56).Â
